definition: to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: The day after, I'll carpool to save money.
Ridesharing can be an ideal way to reduce your personal contribution to pollution.
sentences.chinese: 拼車是降低歸你分擔的污染的理想辦法。

sentences.english: It's hard to share the cost of cars.
Carpooling is so hot before the Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 過年前拼車回家算是‘火’了。

sentences.english: Let's car pool to the stadium, so we can save on gas.
sentences.chinese: 我們拼車去體育場吧，節約油費。

sentences.english: What's your view on car-pooling? Share with us!
sentences.chinese: 你對拼車怎麼看，和大家分享下？

sentences.english: Carpooling is a newly emerging thing.
sentences.chinese: 拼車是一個新興的事物。
爲什麼不能爲上學拼車？

sentences.english: Carpooling is a smart way to share your ride and your expenses.
sentences.chinese: 拼車是一種你們合夥乘車和分攤費用的精明方法。

sentences.english: Traffic was building so he decided to get into the carpool lane on his left.
sentences.chinese: 交通開始變得擁擠，因此他決定換到左側的拼車車道。

sentences.english: Another benefit stemming from carpooling is people do not need to worry about finding a place to park their car.
sentences.chinese: 另一個好處來自拼車是人們不需要擔心找個地方停車。

sentences.english: Try to carpool with other parents to make life easier.
sentences.chinese: 與其他父母們“拼車”會使生活更愜意。

definition: to ride (in a vehicle)/to get a lift/to hitch-hike
Kenting, a national park on the southern tip of Taiwan, popular as a tourist destination (abbr. for 墾丁國家公園|垦丁国家公园[Ken3 ding1 Guo2 jia1 Gong1 yuan2])
vehicle that gives one a free ride/(fig.) (ride on sb's) coattails/(take advantage of) an opportunity
Lhasa, capital city of Tibet autonomous region 西藏自治區|西藏自治区
to go with sb/to form companionships
Lijiang prefecture-level city in northwest Yunnan
to ride (a bicycle, horse, motorbike etc)/cycling/horseback riding/motorbike riding/a ride/CL:次[ci4]
to take a taxi (in town)/to hitch a lift
